confession.devil_appearance: very ugly man of middling build, with grey beard, dressed in grey like wolfskin
confession.seduction_context: Around midnight when she was in bed in house of Jean Mongeon; a widower wanted to marry her but she did not dare because husband had gone to war year before with no news; devil appeared and gave her money (turned to dust), persuaded her to renounce God
sabbat_activities: carried up in air by masters to direct clouds over Rozieres

testimony.quarrel_subject: Asked to buy 'cendres', witness replied she had none
testimony.threat_quote: Ha tante Barbe vous vous en repentirez, et vous en donnez de garde

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: immediately - started yawning, on return home fell down

witnesses.name: Richard Gontiere le jeune
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, beau fils de Colin Gillet

witnesses.name: Bietrix jeune fille a Colin Gillet

testimony.quarrel_subject: Belle fille called her 'genoxe' and she replied that her husband was a 'couquou'
Wife employed 'la petite Chenne' to sew; while waiting for scarves from weaver, got neighbor to prepare sheets; Jehenne was angry saying she could have cut them as well
Same as husband - sewing work dispute
Daughter learning sewing with accused; told moictriere de Cuyttefebre about stolen hens; Jehenne furious with daughter and reproached her

witnesses.name: Laurent Laurent vigneron
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, had employed accused to teach daughter sewing

testimony.quarrel_subject: Had taken daughter away from learning with accused

witnesses.name: Philippe Mongenat femme Poinselat Poinselat
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, accused had room in their house

testimony.quarrel_subject: Daughter aged 3 chattering at church; Jehenne struck her on shoulder
Wife of sieur Clicon at Portesieulx employed witness and companion but not accused's sons anymore
Girls playing with pig's bladder; Didon put it among Jehenne's flax; Jehenne angry
Same story about poisle - pig's bladder incident
About a year before, quarrelled about some cloth he alleged she was trying to steal
Some 6 years before at oven, Jehenne asked for 'un chaude' but she made 'sourde oreille' and did not reply

witnesses.name: Nicolas Claudin jeune fils de Claudon Colas

testimony.quarrel_subject: 6 years earlier attending school with her son Bastien, who stole his Life of Jesus; Bastien wouldn't give it back; mother ran out threatening to throw stones
testimony.threat_quote: threatening to throw stones at him

testimony.quarrel_subject: Some 2 years before she had always been in his poille sewing; heard her say 'le xouaille' instead of 'le diable'; exchange followed in which he implied she was follower of devil

timeline.subject: Jehenne Medexin
timeline.details: Friday - quarrel with Barbe Gillet at market over 'cendres'; threat given; Barbe became deaf, dumb, and blind

timeline.subject: Jehenne Medexin
timeline.details: Monday - Jehenne came to Barbe's house, touched and handled her, she recovered use of faculties but remained paralyzed on left side

timeline.subject: Jehenne Medexin
timeline.details: First interrogation - denied wrongdoing, gave personal history

timeline.subject: Jehenne Medexin
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses including bedside visit to Barbe Gillet

timeline.subject: Jehenne Medexin
timeline.details: More confrontations; voluntary confession on way back to prison

timeline.subject: Jehenne Medexin
timeline.details: Interrogation - full confession of seduction by devil, sabbat attendance, maleficia; then retracted all confessions after an hour

timeline.subject: Jehenne Medexin
timeline.details: Rémy asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Jehenne Medexin
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - immediately renewed confessions, confessed to additional maleficia, thumbscrews applied, then racked, named accomplices

timeline.subject: Jehenne Medexin
timeline.details: Rémy asks for execution by burning alive, citing parricide among other crimes

timeline.subject: Jehenne Medexin
timeline.details: Court at St Nicolas passes definitive sentence - to be burned alive

accomplices_named.name: Jean Degatte's mother-in-law
accomplices_named.context: Thought she had seen at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: widow of Claudon Aubert
accomplices_named.context: Thought she had seen at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: wife of Mengin Lamourou
accomplices_named.context: Named under torture (racked), could not maintain this definitely

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne Medexin to Barbe Gillet
notable_quotes.french: Ha tante Barbe vous vous en repentirez, et vous en donnez de garde
notable_quotes.english: Ha aunt Barbe you will repent of this, and take care
notable_quotes.context: After Barbe refused to sell her 'cendres' at market

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbe Gillet to Jehenne Medexin
notable_quotes.french: Je suis bien tenue a toy de m'avoir donné ce mal
notable_quotes.english: I am obliged to you for having given me this illness
notable_quotes.context: After Jehenne came and touched her, restoring her faculties

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne Medexin
notable_quotes.english: I pardon them for my death
notable_quotes.context: Speaking about accusations, saying if they think she's a witch they should have her taken and killed

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne to Catherine Bernel about Didon
notable_quotes.context: When Didon returned crying and ill after Jehenne had threatened 'tu en auras une esbuche'

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne about Claudon wife of second echevin's boy
notable_quotes.french: il ne meure pas, c'est le mal qui meure sur luy
notable_quotes.english: he will not die, it is the illness that dies on him
notable_quotes.context: Looking at and touching the swollen boy, who then immediately started to recover

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne final statement
notable_quotes.french: lors que le Sr prevost la chassit hors de la ville y a quelque quatre ans, pour la soubconner sorciere, qu'il eut desia beaucoup mieulx vallu et eut bien desiré qu'on fit son proces, et qu'elle a faict beaucoup de maulx depuis, qu'elle n'eut pas faict
notable_quotes.english: when the Sieur prévôt chased her out of the village some four years ago for suspecting her of being a witch, it would have been much better and she would have wished they had prosecuted her then, and she has done much evil since that she would not have done
notable_quotes.context: Final statement after torture, expressing regret that trial didn't happen sooner

relationships.evidence_text: First marriage to Nicolas Thieriat lasted only 3 years
Second marriage was to Bastien de Neufville, lasted 5 or 6 years, then he went off with army of duc de Bouillon
Her brother had been first husband of accused
Bietrix jeune fille a Colin Gillet
Nicolas Claudin jeune fils de Claudon Colas

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over sewing work; accused was a seamstress who worked by the day for various households. Several quarrels arose when work was given to others or taken away from her. Economic vulnerability suggested by second husband being 'often in prison' and having 'no profession', and by her seeking small payments (wine, 'cendres', 'chaude'). She offered to say chapelet daily for regular wine supply. Witness testimony mentions she had been chased out of village 4 years before for witch suspicion.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became deaf, dumb, and blind; fell down; paralyzed down left side
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Asked to buy 'cendres', witness refused saying she had none
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: immediately - started yawning, then on return home fell down

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fell ill, had to be carried to and from bed for next month
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Wife got neighbor to prepare sheets for sewing instead of waiting for accused; Jehenne angry saying she could have cut them as well

harms_catalog.harm_description: Whole body and face twisted, like a monster rather than a creature
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Daughter told about stolen hens; Jehenne furious and reproached her

harms_catalog.harm_description: Strange illness lasting only 24 hours, so stiff she could not bend limbs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Had taken daughter away from learning to sew with accused

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill and died after 2 months
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel with her mother (now dead)

harms_catalog.harm_description: Strangely ill, died after 9 months quite emaciated but with stomach swollen
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Daughter chattering at church; Jehenne struck her on shoulder

harms_catalog.harm_description: Violent pain in back preventing work, lasted some 3 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Employer wanted witness and companion to continue but not accused's sons
harms_catalog.method_alleged: bread and salt from Jehenne's house to cure

harms_catalog.harm_description: Suddenly became ill, died 15 days later
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Girls playing with pig's bladder; Didon put it among Jehenne's flax; asked pardon but Jehenne threatened her
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder in doorway (confessed); alternatively asked master to do it

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill, died six months later 'as dry as a log of wood'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrelled about some cloth he alleged she was trying to steal

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill as if burning
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: At oven, Jehenne asked for 'un chaude' but witness made 'deaf ear' and did not reply
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder (confessed); refused to sell patteneyes; touch to cure

harms_catalog.harm_description: Very ill, all swollen, expected to die
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness had refused to give wine for saying chapelet

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill from 'petits roys' to Easter
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Her son Bastien stole his Life of Jesus and wouldn't return it; mother ran out threatening to throw stones
harms_catalog.method_alleged: bread and salt to cure (took eggs to 'rougir' at her house)

harms_catalog.harm_description: Burned when mother left her alone by fire, clothes caught light
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Exchange in which he implied she was follower of devil after hearing her say 'le xouaille' instead of 'le diable'

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost cow suddenly
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Same as above - devil accusation

harms_catalog.harm_description: Brought to bed of stillborn child
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Prévôt beat her after she reproached him for beating his wife on account of chambermaid
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder in doorway by well (intended for Prévôt but wife passed instead)

harms_catalog.harm_description: unclear whether she died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Partly because she did not treat accused well, partly because accused had no power over father

harms_catalog.harm_description: Killed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Bore grudge against Prévôt because he had chased away her husband, but had no power over him

harms_catalog.harm_description: Killed several dogs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Ongoing grudge against Prévôt

harms_catalog.harm_description: Killed some cows
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: His first wife was hostile to her

harms_catalog.harm_description: Killed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He was a bad manager and had sold a house and some vines without her knowledge

harms_catalog.victim_name: Claudon wife of her brother Nicolas Thiery
harms_catalog.harm_description: Killed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She had been responsible for brother's imprisonment after he cheated when making cloth for Demenge Marchal

harms_catalog.victim_name: mother of Hellewix fille Pierron Bouchier
harms_catalog.harm_description: Always had trouble with eyes after quarrel, previously perfectly good
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrelling with accused after daughter's illness; accused called her 'peu yeulx, peu regard'

material_culture.context: Barbe refused to sell cendres to Jehenne at market, precipitating quarrel
Waiting for scarves from weaver for sewing work
Neighbor prepared sheets for sewing instead of Jehenne
Healing remedy - make hole, take water that forms with small spoon, rub on skin
Jehenne brought to cure Claudon Pougnant's twisted body
Obtained from Jehenne's house to cure illness (appears twice)
Jehenne came to sprinkle body with holy water; Nicolas Claudin's duty as clerc to sprinkle
Her son Bastien stole Nicolas Claudin's Life of Jesus
Girls playing with it at poisle; put among Jehenne's flax
Jehenne's flax where pig's bladder was hidden
Jehenne asked Claudon Laudart for 'un chaude' at oven
Claudon Laudart refused to sell patteneyes to Jehenne
Jehenne offered to say chapelet daily in exchange for regular wine
Jehenne offered to say chapelet for wine; moictrier promised pilgrimage
Nicolas Claudin took eggs to 'rougir' at Jehenne's house for healing
Nicolas Ozelle accused Jehenne of trying to steal cloth
Her son Villemin took shirt she kept in small chest
Devil gave her money which turned out to be only dust

material_culture.object: three kinds of powder (black, grey, white)
material_culture.context: Devil gave her black powder to kill, grey to make ill, white to cure
Wore at sabbat; said she burned it for fear of discovery
First husband sold without her knowledge
Prévôt had two journals of wheat baked for Jehenne and first husband; she allegedly hid at mother's house

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; where accused lived and most events occurred
Native place of Jehenne; origin; mentioned she came from there and belle fille called her 'genoxe'
Court location; where Demenge Marchal consulted woman about 'mal donné'; final sentence passed there
Where sieur Clicon's wife employed the sewing girls
Moictrier de Cuyttefebvre promised to make pilgrimage there
Sabbat location where masked men and women were dancing and feasting
Where pig's bladder incident occurred with Didon
Where Jehenne approached Barbe Gillet asking to buy cendres
Where Estienne Eulry's wife took daughter and Jehenne struck her
Where Claudon Laudart ignored Jehenne's request for 'un chaude'
Where Jehenne said she threw all her powders for fear they be found
Where Jehenne lived 16-17 years earlier when devil first appeared; attacked her 3-4 nights there
Where she went behind during hailstorm; neighbor was praying to God

historical_context.military_details: Second husband Bastien de Neufville went off with army of duc de Bouillon and had heard they were all drowned. Referenced 'le Prince d'Orange' as temporal marker for when she arrived at Rozieres.
weather_events: great hailstorm two and a half years before confession (around 1601)
hail-making at sabbat - masters carried them up in air to direct clouds over Rozieres
economic_hardship_indicators: second husband 'often in prison' because he was 'mal sage'
prévôt chased her out of village 4 years before for witch suspicion
religious_calendar_references: from 'petits roys' to Easter (witness 24 - illness duration)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Second husband Bastien de Neufville was often in prison because he was 'mal sage'
Her brother Nicolas Thiery imprisoned after cheating when making cloth for Demenge Marchal

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Kept in 'fond de fosse' (bottom of pit); asked not to be returned there; asked to be taken to questioning room to think things over; kept under guard in room overnight on 20 November

hearsay_chains.content: Mother always said she suspected Jehenne for child's death
During illness Didon said Jehenne was cause of her woes

emotional_state_notes: asked not to be returned to 'fond de fosse'
asked to be taken back to questioning room to think things over
thought for around an hour then suddenly denied all confessions, said she feared damning herself
begged to be released from thumbscrews
final statement expressing regret trial didn't happen 4 years earlier

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Blamed Barbe Gillet's illness itself for the accusation
Denied beating Claudon Pougnant after chicken visit
Denied killing Laurent Laurent's daughter, saying 'qu'elle l'aymoit trop'
If son called her witch, it was when he was drunk; his wife was not 'sage' and was a whore
Dispute was on account of his failure to sprinkle holy water at her house for 5-6 Sundays as clerc
Denied giving remedy with 'patteneye'; later said she suggested they consult wife of Claude le Cordonnier who used the remedy

third_parties.name: Didon (chambermaid)
third_parties.context: Victim of alleged maleficium; put pig's bladder among Jehenne's flax; died 15 days after becoming ill

third_parties.name: moictriere de Cuyttefebre
third_parties.context: Complained about stolen hens; later visited Claudon Pougnant and promised pilgrimage to Notre Dame de Fricourt

third_parties.name: wife of sieur Clicon at Portesieulx
third_parties.context: Employed sewing girls including Hellewix and daughter of Richard Gontiere, but not accused's sons

third_parties.name: woman at St Nicolas
third_parties.context: Demenge Marchal consulted her about 'mal donné'; she told him he would find the person who did it before reaching home

third_parties.name: wife of Claude le Cordonnier
third_parties.context: Jehenne suggested they consult her; she had used the patteneye remedy

third_parties.name: Villemin
third_parties.context: Son of accused; beat her and called her witch; cats fighting on roof at night when they lived together

third_parties.name: Bastien
third_parties.context: Son of accused; attended school with Nicolas Claudin; stole his Life of Jesus

third_parties.name: Nicolas des Bordes
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: first husband (alternative name for Nicolas Thieriat)
third_parties.context: First husband; she confessed under torture to killing him because he was bad manager and sold house and vines without her knowledge

third_parties.name: Margueritte (chambermaid)
third_parties.context: Chambermaid at Prévôt's house; Prévôt beat his wife on her account; Jehenne reproached him for this

third_parties.name: Andreu Tantette
third_parties.context: Neighbor; during hailstorm Jehenne went behind his house while he was praying to God, preventing devil from carrying her off

third_parties.name: Nicolas Thiery
third_parties.context: Brother; imprisoned after cheating when making cloth for Demenge Marchal; his wife Claudon allegedly killed by Jehenne

third_parties.name: belle fille (daughter-in-law)
third_parties.context: Called Jehenne 'genoxe' at Blainville; Jehenne replied her husband was 'couquou'

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a well-documented trial with 25 witnesses and detailed confession records. Key uncertainties: (1) Whether Nicolas des Bordes and Nicolas Thieriat are the same person - the text suggests des Bordes was the first husband under torture confession, but earlier she said Nicolas Thieriat was first husband. This needs clarification. (2) The relationship to Nicolas Thiery - listed as 'her brother' but may be brother-in-law through first marriage. (3) Whether the 17-year-old daughter of Prévôt died is explicitly marked as unclear in the text. (4) The identity of 'belle fille' who called her 'genoxe' - could be daughter-in-law or step-daughter. (5) Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on: seamstress working by the day, seeking small payments, second husband with no profession and often imprisoned, chased from village 4 years before. (6) Practiced healing: YES - she cured multiple people by touch, provided yellow lard, suggested patteneye remedy, provided bread and salt; witnesses explicitly believed she could both cause and cure illness. Healing types: touch_healing is clear; 'other' includes remedies like patteneye, yellow lard, bread and salt which don't fit standard categories. (7) Language region: FRENCH - all quotes are in French, location is Lorraine, testimony patterns typical of French-speaking region. (8) The trial shows extensive evidence of healing practices being reinterpreted as witchcraft - she was regularly called upon to cure illnesses, suggesting prior reputation as healer before witch accusation.
